text: Padre Sebastiano is a 1904–1906 painting by John Singer Sargent. It is part of the collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The painting depicts Father Sebastiano, an Italian priest whom the artist met in Giomein, a village in the Italian Alps. The subject had a serious interest in botany, hence the wild flowers covering his bed. The work is on view in the Metropolitan Museum's Gallery 770. ==See also== * 1906 in art ==References== Category:1906 paintings Category:20th-century portraits Category:Paintings by John Singer Sargent Category:Paintings of the Metropolitan Museum of Art Category:Portraits of men
